Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: !startpull
Works in any chat channel so other people in your group can type it in group chat if desired.
For this trigger to work, a HoT tick must have occured on your character since last changing zones. After typing the !startpull command into any chat channel ingame (/echo works too), the trigger will send a keypress to your game.
By default it sends keycode 105 which is NumPad9. Reference this website if you intend on changing it to anything else: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.keys?view=netcore-3.1
Ingame, you will have to assign a pull macro that is a multiple of 3 seconds long to the keybind you are sending to the game, your macro can be as simple as /cd 15 The trigger will wait an amount of time corresponding to where your actor tick is at to send the keypress to consistently enable a good anatman window for the anatman opener. This necessary wait value may depend on your personal habits with how fast you engage the boss relative to the pull timer, should you find that you need to change the timing, head over to the scheduling tab of the trigger action inside of this trigger and change the 3500 to a lower number to have the tick happen earlier or to a higher number to have the tick happen later.
As you might imagine, this trigger is mostly intended for optimizing in a static environment and pugs will probably not be pleased with you asking for a HoT after zoning in and letting you do the pull timer.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
!! In order for this trigger to work, a HoT tick must have occured on your character since you last changed zones. !!
Ingame commands: /echo !tickshow /echo !tickhide
To move the progress bar to a different location, open the "Move me!" action in the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, click "Use visual guide for placement", move it to where you want and right click to save the location.

Folder.Name: Auto Attack Timer 1.0 (don't put in zone locked folders)

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: /echo !aashow /echo !aahide
To move the progress bar, switch to the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, double click the first action named "Move me!" and click the button saying "Use visual guide for placement". You can then drag it to whereever you want, save your selection with right click -> save and everything will automatically adjust to where you put it. If you move it while already enabled, you will need to use the /echo !aashow command again for it to update.
The trigger will show a progress bar displaying the time until your next auto attack is ready. Works exclusively for combat jobs and is intended for play at level 80 since lower levels weapons don't always have the same delay as level 80 weapons, I can't actually tell what your weapon delay is and just assume it's at the value that's standard for your job for current max level weapons.
The only auto attack speed effects the trigger will take into account are SAM/BLM/WHM/NIN/MNK/BRD haste effects so you will not see any slows enemies put on you properly reflected here since I'd need to implement each of those individually.
This trigger won't work within zone locked folders due to relying on network lines
If you break something tell me on discord, Aya#0847 --------------- Documentation on how auto attack edge cases work:
Haste effects being gained/lost between autos: Your next auto will happen based on the current haste effects - if you lose greased lightning 0.1s before an auto attack, that entire auto attack will be moved back as if you never had greased lightning. Conversely, gaining a haste effect does the opposite thing and moves the next auto forward in accordance with how potent that haste effect is - gaining a haste effect just before an auto that would have happened anyway soon will result in it happening instantly as you gain the effect. All this is reflected correctly in the trigger.
Casts: Using anything with a cast bar pauses your auto attack timer until you make it to the slidecast window and this behavior should work properly in the trigger.
Channels: Channeling something like improvisation on dancer simply disables your ability to auto attack but the timer will still progress as normal.
TCJ: Tracking the time until first auto after TCJ is not supported due to TCJ being extremely weird. The first auto attack after it will happen at the first possible time that is your auto delay + some whole number. For example, without huton your auto delay is 2.56 and your next auto after TCJ can only occur after 3.56s, 4.56s, 5.56s, 6.56s... etc. relative to the last auto before TCJ. As such, I simply don't know when your next auto will be until TCJ ends, at which point it will never take more than a full second for another auto attack to occur, implementing support for that is more effort than it's worth.

Trigger.Name: Counter
Trigger.Description:
After importing this trigger for the first time, restart ACT once or switch zones or jobs ingame to make sure the settings trigger fires. Do this on first use and any time you edit the chakraScaling variable in the Settings trigger.
Ingame commands: /echo !chakrashow /echo !chakrahide
To move the location of the stuff displayed by this trigger, enter the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, open the action named "Move me!" and click "Use visual guide for placement", Drag it whereever you want, save the changes and you're done. To see the change take effect, make sure to hide and then show the overlay again.
This trigger displays the beautiful face of our lord and savior Yoshida alongside a counter of how much chakra you've lost to overcapping. Counter resets on raid wipes/clears and zone changes.
You can change the size of it by setting the value of the variable the Settings trigger sets to something else, but since I can't modify font sizes based on variables so you'll have to manually mess with font sizes if you wish to change the size. For the best experience, leave it as it is and bear with him staring into your soul.
You may see the Backend folder turning itself on and off, it'll be off when you're not on monk to save resources.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
After importing this trigger for the first time, restart ACT once or switch zones or jobs ingame to make sure the settings trigger fires. Do this on first use and any time you edit the chakraScaling variable in the Settings trigger.
Ingame commands: /echo !chakrashow /echo !chakrahide
To move the location of the stuff displayed by this trigger, enter the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, open the action named "Move me!" and click "Use visual guide for placement", Drag it whereever you want, save the changes and you're done. To see the change take effect, make sure to hide and then show the overlay again.
This trigger displays the beautiful face of our lord and savior Yoshida alongside a counter of how much chakra you've lost to overcapping. Counter resets on raid wipes/clears and zone changes or you can manually reset it by using !chakrashow again.
You can change the size of it by setting the value of the variable the Settings trigger sets to something else, but since I can't modify font sizes based on variables so you'll have to manually mess with font sizes if you wish to change the size. For the best experience, leave it as it is and bear with him staring into your soul.
You may see the Backend folder turning itself on and off, that happens depending on whether you are currently showing the overlay.

Trigger.Name: README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame Commands: /echo !dotshow /echo !dothide
To move the overlay, head to the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, double click the "Move me!" action and press the "Use visual guide for placement" button. Drag it to where you want it, right click and save its location.
Backend folder will show as disabled or enabled depending on if you're currently showing the overlay, no need to mess with that manually.
Whitelisted DoTs are any that match the regex of the "Watch DoT Application" trigger, by default all the max level healer DoTs.

Trigger.Name: TTS (for all but the BLM orange set 2 blue markers)

Folder.Name: BLM Relative Rocks v1.2 (README inside, turn this folder on to use)

Trigger.Name: Find BLM color + set 2 blue players
!README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
This trigger alls out your cardinal/intercardinal position as seen in https://media.discordapp.net/attachments/786557239292985364/798996683685232640/blm_uptime.png
The folder that does all the stuff automatically turns on for a minute when the boss uses Earthen Fury, it turns itself off to save resources.
The "Priority" trigger dictates who gets priority on the northeast blue spot in set 2 when BLM has orange, it's easy to modify and the order the jobs are added to the list there is the priority and you can move jobs up or down to modify it to your liking. Make sure your entire group has the same priority set there or people can get the same blue spot called. Higher up in the trigger = higher priority to be picked for northeast.
If you're the BLM don't use this, you're afk northwest anyway and all the DPS TTS assumes that it's from the non-BLM pov. Your job is to convince your entire party to use this.
Version history: v1.1: Added TTS for set 3 v1.2: Folder now won't activate if there is no BLM in the party (since you're probably not doing this strat then)

Action.UseTTSTextExpression: Bait at blue, move to orange
Bait at orange, move to blue

Trigger.Name: Prismatic Solver 1.6 (README in Description tab of this trigger)
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the this trigger.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release v1.5: Rewrote part of this trigger to have fewer moving parts since it wasn't executing consistently v1.6: I swear to god this thing works now

Folder.Name: Combat (READMEs inside folders, enable whatever you want)

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
!! In order for this trigger to work, a HoT tick must have occured on your character since you last changed zones. !!
Ingame commands: /echo !tickshow /echo !tickhide
In order to change the location of the progress bar, first copy this entire folder to local triggers or you can't edit anything. Don't have it enabled as a local and remote trigger at the same time!
To move the progress bar to a different location, open the "Move me!" action in the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, click "Use visual guide for placement", move it to where you want and right click to save the location.

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description: This trigger calls out ghosted hits (i.e. abilities you casted but that didn't connect due to the boss becoming invulnerable or already being dead).

Trigger.Name: !README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
Ingame commands: /echo !aashow /echo !aahide
When enabling this trigger for the first time, either restart ACT or switch jobs ingame once so it initializes all of its variables.
In order to change the location of the progress bar, first copy this entire folder to local triggers or you can't edit anything. Don't have it enabled as a local and remote trigger at the same time!
To move the progress bar, switch to the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger, double click the first action named "Move me!" and click the button saying "Use visual guide for placement". You can then drag it to whereever you want, save your selection with right click -> save and everything will automatically adjust to where you put it. If you move it while already enabled, you will need to use the /echo !aashow command again for it to update.
The trigger will show a progress bar displaying the time until your next auto attack is ready. Works exclusively for combat jobs and is intended for play at level 80 since lower levels weapons don't always have the same delay as level 80 weapons, I can't actually tell what your weapon delay is and just assume it's at the value that's standard for your job for current max level weapons.
The only auto attack speed effects the trigger will take into account are SAM/BLM/WHM/NIN/MNK/BRD haste effects so you will not see any slows enemies put on you properly reflected here since I'd need to implement each of those individually.
This trigger won't work within zone locked folders due to relying on network lines
If you break something tell me on discord, Aya#0847 --------------- Documentation on how auto attack edge cases work:
Haste effects being gained/lost between autos: Your next auto will happen based on the current haste effects - if you lose greased lightning 0.1s before an auto attack, that entire auto attack will be moved back as if you never had greased lightning. Conversely, gaining a haste effect does the opposite thing and moves the next auto forward in accordance with how potent that haste effect is - gaining a haste effect just before an auto that would have happened anyway soon will result in it happening instantly as you gain the effect. All this is reflected correctly in the trigger.
Casts: Using anything with a cast bar pauses your auto attack timer until you make it to the slidecast window and this behavior should work properly in the trigger.
Channels: Channeling something like improvisation on dancer simply disables your ability to auto attack but the timer will still progress as normal.
TCJ: Tracking the time until first auto after TCJ is not supported due to TCJ being extremely weird. The first auto attack after it will happen at the first possible time that is your auto delay + some whole number. For example, without huton your auto delay is 2.56 and your next auto after TCJ can only occur after 3.56s, 4.56s, 5.56s, 6.56s... etc. relative to the last auto before TCJ. As such, I simply don't know when your next auto will be until TCJ ends, at which point it will never take more than a full second for another auto attack to occur, implementing support for that is more effort than it's worth.

Trigger.Name: Pick your snapshots (README in Description tab of this trigger)
Trigger.Description:
By default, nothing in this trigger is enabled. Pick whether you want a keypress to be sent or a beep to occur at the snapshots of the supported mechanics by checking the box next to the corresponding triggers in the "Trigger actions" tab of this trigger.. The keypress actions are meant to be used to use Shoulder Tackle (or other gapclosers if other melee jobs end up using this) right as the snapshot happens.
In order to use any of the keybind sending actions, you need to edit the "Gapcloser Keybind" trigger. It sets a variable that by default contains the number 49 which would result in a "1" keypress being sent to your game, but that's probably not most people's gapcloser keybind. Head over to https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.keys?view=net-5.0 to find the number you have to enter for the key of your choice to be sent. Note that some keys are not listed and no keybinds with modifiers (i.e. ctrl, alt, shift + anything) are supported, but you can simply put your gapcloser on another hotbar and bind it to something else there specifically for the purposes of the trigger. Keybinds still work even if you hide said hotbar.
When any of the snapshots the keybind trigger actions look for occur, it will begin mashing the keybind of your choice for up to 500 ms or until Shoulder Tackle was used, whatever happens first. The mashing stopping when the cast is seen won't work for other jobs by default, if you're using this for non-ST gapclosers edit the action ID in the regex of the "Button Presser" trigger from 47 to whatever ID (in hex) your job's gap closer is.
Changelog: v1.1: Made it mash the button a bunch v1.2: No longer has a stroke after shoulder tackles v1.3: Previously, if 2 or more got hit by the snapshot, it wouldn't recognize it v1.4: Previously, if 2 or more got hit by the snaphot, it'd fire twice v1.5: Would previously freak out if you were playing with another Monk

Action.Description: E9s Wide Angle final AoE (Send keypress)

Trigger.Name: Concealed
Trigger.Description: why are there no lookup operations for table variables

Trigger.Name: README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the TTS trigger, but don't move the actions up or down since that breaks some conditions.
If you experience a wrong call, ideally provide a video clip of it and a copy of your log file to me over at Aya#0847 on discord so I can look into it. If you experience no call whatsoever, your audio settings prevent triggernometry TTS from reaching you or you aren't on triggernometry version 1.1.3.1 or above which this trigger requires.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release

Trigger.Name: README in Description tab of this trigger
Trigger.Description:
This trigger calls out Prismatic Deception safe spots when the casts of Blasting Zone start on the enemy list. The calls by default are North, Northeast, East, Southeast, obviously the cardinal/intercardinal direction opposite of what the trigger calls will be safe too. If you prefer, you can change the things the TTS actions call in the Trigger Actions tab of the TTS trigger, but don't move the actions up or down since that breaks some conditions.
If you experience a wrong call, ideally provide a video clip of it and a copy of your log file to me over at Aya#0847 on discord so I can look into it. If you experience no call whatsoever, your audio settings prevent triggernometry TTS from reaching you or you aren't on triggernometry version 1.1.3.1 or above which this trigger requires.
The debug trigger will write list variables for each recorded actor the trigger believes to be about to cast the line AOE so it can be tracked what information it was working with when making the TTS decision. Turn on if you care.
Version History: v1.4: Public Release v1.5: Rewrote part of this trigger to have fewer moving parts since it wasn't executing consistently v1.6: I swear to god this thing works now
